member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameNotificationSink.OutputFrameType
member.summary: Returns the current FrameType. When this is running/build it returns the FrameType of the ImageBuffers otherwise it returns the first FrameType of the FrameTypes().

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.FrameNotificationSink
member.summary: FrameNotificationSink class can be used to get overhead free access to the images coming from the camera. You can create an instance of this class via the Create functions.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.IFrameNotificationSinkListener.FrameReceived(TIS.Imaging.IFrame)
member.summary:
FrameReceived gets called when a new frame is received.
NOTE: the passed in frame gets destroyed after this method returns. So you should not store a reference to this outside of this callback.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.IFrameNotificationSinkListener.SinkDisconnected
member.summary: SinkDisconnected gets called when the sink is disconnected in LiveStop.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.IFrameNotificationSinkListener.SinkConnected(TIS.Imaging.FrameType)
member.summary: SinkConnected gets called when the sink is connected in LivePrepare or LiveStart.
member.param: The TIS.Imaging.FrameType of the TIS.Imaging.IFrame that will be streamed by this sink.

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.IFrameNotificationSinkListener
member.summary: Derive from this class to receive events from the FrameNotificationSink

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.FrameQueueSink
member.summary: Implements a Sink

members.member: Specifies what to do with the passed in IFrameQueueBuffer after this method returns. If you return ReQueue the buffer is re-queued into the FrameQueueSink. If you return SkipRequeue, then the function expects the user to either re-queue the buffer by hand or discard the buffer.

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.ICImagingControl
member.summary: Summary for ICImagingControl

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.FrameFilterInfo
member.summary: Base class for filter information

members.member: Returns true if at least one ImageBuffer is contained in a ImageBuffers::get call.
Returns the last acquired buffer, or null if no such buffer is available.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.ICException.create(DShowLib.Error!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced)
member.summary: Creates a exception type equivalent to the err.getVal() enum entry. This may be a OutOfMemory or ArgumentException, or in other cases an ICException object.

members.member: Frames dropped due to unspecified circumstances (mostly a cop out when the driver does not provide the actual drop info)
Frames dropped due to overrunning queue on the application side. Mostly due to Callbacks taking to much time to copy data from driver buffers into application buffers
Frames dropped in the driver, most likely because the system is too slow to transform the images from the transport format into the actual exported format.
Frames dropped due to incomplete data received, either because of bandwidth problems or problems with the transportation medium
Frames dropped in the device itself
Frames delivered at the highest driver level before handing of to DirectShow/ICImagingControl
Internal class only used in FrameQueueBuffer::Create

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.IFrameQueueBuffer.Tag
member.summary: The tag can be set by the user to allow tracking of IFrameQueueBuffer instances. E.g. tracking self allocated buffers.

members.member: Copy frame meta data and the Ptr contents from src to dst without checking that the FrameTypes match

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.FrameExtensions.SaveAsTiff(TIS.Imaging.IFrame,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the frame contents in a TIFF file.
member.param: Specifies the path to the destination file

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.FrameExtensions.SaveAsJpeg(TIS.Imaging.IFrame,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves the frm parameter into a Jpeg file.
member.param: Specifies the JPEG quality in the range of [0;100]

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.FrameExtensions.SaveAsBitmap(TIS.Imaging.IFrame,System.String,TIS.Imaging.ICImagingControlColorformats)
member.summary: Saves the frm parameter into a Bitmap file of the type passed in fmt. E.g. You can save a Y800 IFrame into a RGB24 formated bitmap file.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.FrameExtensions.SaveAsBitmap(TIS.Imaging.IFrame,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the frm parameter into a Bitmap file.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.FrameExtensions.CreateBitmapCopy(TIS.Imaging.IFrame)
member.summary: Creates a new Bitmap object which copies the contents of the IFrame parameter.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.FrameExtensions.CreateBitmapWrap(TIS.Imaging.IFrame)
member.summary: Creates a System.Drawing.Bitmap object which internally points to the same memory as the IFrame. This means that the IFrame must 'live' at least as long as the returned Bitmap and if the contents of the IFrame changes, the contents of the Bitmap does too.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.IFrame.AdditionalFrameDataBlob
member.summary: Contains additional frame specific data blob.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.IFrame.FrameMetadata
member.summary: Contains frame meta data.

member.name: M:TIS.Imaging.IFrame.CopyFrom(TIS.Imaging.IFrame)
member.summary: Copies the contents of src into this frame. This may throw NotImplemented when this IFrame cannot be copied into.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.IFrame.ActualDataSize
member.summary: Actual data size in this frame. This can differ from FrameType.BufferSize for compressed formats. Note: The value on set may be ignored when accessing an input frame

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.IFrame
member.summary:
Interface for frames used in the library.
Do not directly inherit from this interface, inherit from TIS.Imaging.UserFrame or TIS.Imaging.FrameQueueBufferBase when you need to create a user object.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.MediaSampleInfoFlags
member.summary: Contains frame device/driver specific flags.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.DeviceFrameNumber
member.summary:
Contains the frame number of this frame as specified by the device.
Note: This may be 0 when the device does not track the frame number.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.DeviceTimeStamp
member.summary:
Contains the time stamp of this frame as specified by the device.
Note: This may be 0 when the device does not pass timestamps to the driver. This is supplied in device dependent time units.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.DriverFrameLastPacketTime
member.summary:
The time at which the last packet of this frame was received by the driver.
Note: This may be 0 when the driver does not track this time.
Note: The time source is driver specific.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.DriverFrameFirstPacketTime
member.summary:
The time at which the first packet of this frame was received by the driver.
Note: This may be 0 when the driver does not track this time.
Note: The time source is driver specific.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.DriverFrameNumber
member.summary: The frame number the driver assigned this to frame.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.SampleFlags
member.summary: Flags specific to the device/driver.

member.name: P:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata.SampleStartTime
member.summary:
Contains the graph time at which this frame was passed into the DirectShow graph.
May be 0 when not accessible

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.FrameMetadata
member.summary: Contains IFrame metadata.

member.name: T:TIS.Imaging.FrameType
member.summary: Contains a definition of the type of a Frame or ImageBuffer. The subtype or FourCC defines the format of the data in the image. Width and HEight define the dimensions of the frame. BufferSize describes the actual memory size of the frame.
